sections.section_instructions: Choose the correct letter A, B, C or D. Write the correct letter in boxes 1-3 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: What does the writer say about the performance of older typists on the test?

options.A: They used different motor skills from younger typists.
options.B: They had been more efficiently trained than younger typists.
options.C: They used more time-saving techniques than younger typists.
options.D: They had better concentration skills than younger typists.

questions.question_text: The experiment with the rats showed that

options.A: brain structure only changed when the rats were given a familiar toy.
options.B: the rats became anxious after a lengthy period of time alone.
options.C: the rats lived longer then they were part of a social group.
options.D: the rats' brains expanded or shrank depending on the level of mental activity.

questions.question_text: A comparison between adults and children who played chess showed that

options.A: the children were as capable as the adults of remembering a series of numbers.
options.B: the children had better recall of the layout of pieces.
options.C: the adults stored memories of chess moves in a more logical manner.
options.D: the adults had clearer memories of chess games they had played.

sections.section_instructions: Complete the summary below. Choose ONE WORD ONLY from the passage for each answer. Write your answers in boxes 4-9 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: Psychologists distinguish between two different types of memory: _____ and _____ memory.
Psychologists distinguish between two different types of memory: _____ and _____ memory.
A study was conducted into people's knowledge of _____ to determine recall ability.
School also helps with a brain function called _____ .
This is why a more highly educated person is generally more successful and does better in _____ tests.
Some of our mental functions remain unaffected by age or even improve. For example, as we get older, our knowledge of _____ increases.

sections.section_instructions: Look at the following statements and the list of people below. Match each statement with the correct person, A-E. Write the correct letter, A-E, in boxes 10-13 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: The educational system makes students aware of how their memory works.
Although older people may use a different mental approach when completing a task, they can still achieve the same result as younger people.
Being open to new ways of doing things can have a positive impact on your mental condition as we get older.
Both animals and humans need to exist in an environment full of interest.
